title: Foundations of Image Generation — Module 1 Quiz

questions.question: In diffusion models like Stable Diffusion, what is the model trained to do?

options.text: Add random noise to an image until it disappears
Learn how to remove noise to reconstruct the original image
Predict the next word in a sentence
Translate images into other languages

questions.explanation: The model learns to reverse a noise process — denoising images step-by-step until a coherent image forms.

questions.question: Diffusion models can generate new images starting entirely from random noise.

options.text: True
False

questions.explanation: After training, diffusion models can start from noise and denoise into entirely new, unseen images.

questions.question: What role does the text encoder play in text-to-image models?

options.text: It removes background noise from the generated image
It converts text prompts into numerical representations the model can understand
It resizes the image to higher resolution
It decides the file format for image output

questions.explanation: Text encoders map natural language into embeddings that condition the denoising process.

questions.question: Which statement best describes the autoregressive approach used by Google’s Parti model?

options.text: It denoises an image over many steps using Gaussian noise
It predicts sequences of image tokens based on sequences of text tokens
It adds noise to images to simulate diffusion
It is identical to diffusion but runs faster

questions.explanation: Parti uses a sequence-to-sequence architecture — predicting visual tokens from text tokens, like a translator for images.

questions.question: What is one main reason larger diffusion models tend to produce higher-quality images?

options.text: They use more detailed fonts
They have more parameters to capture fine-grained patterns in data
They process fewer denoising steps
They are trained on less data for efficiency

questions.explanation: Larger models with more parameters capture subtle correlations between text and image features.

questions.question: The AI Test Kitchen allows public testing of new experimental models from Google Research.

options.text: True
False

questions.explanation: Google’s AI Test Kitchen lets users try and provide feedback on emerging AI systems like Imagen and Parti.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the 'denoising' process in diffusion models?

options.text: Iteratively removing noise guided by text embeddings to form an image
Compressing an image to a smaller size
Applying filters to sharpen real photos
Replacing image tokens with random pixels

questions.explanation: Denoising is the iterative process that constructs a final image guided by a text-conditioned latent representation.

questions.question: Stable Diffusion and Imagen use the same underlying architecture.

options.text: True
False

questions.explanation: Stable Diffusion uses a diffusion-based latent model; Imagen uses a text-conditioned diffusion trained at higher fidelity with proprietary data.
